issue.title: Error in Safari
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version latest ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? apkmirror ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I saw the issue and found that there was a problem with the adshield in apkmirror. So, after checking the adshield domain, I checked that popup filter works differently in safari. I made an exception to the shield pop-up filter and it worked well. When I turned on the adguard, the domain request seems to be blocked. In safari, I think we need to block the pop-up in another way. So there was no problem with Chrome and firefox, but I think it was a problem because the filter worked differently in Safari. Filters that are only problematic in Safari 2. Screenshots

Enable user rules
Disable user rules

comment.body:
@piquark6046

This is reproducible with Firefox Developer Edition from my side (reset-ed entire settings and installed List-KR only). It appears to hide the class, `.ad_banner` from the easylist [^0]. To work around this, I wrote `clien.net#@#.ad_banner^$important` in the user rule. There are several articles about this issue [^1] [^2]. I would appreciate it if you could check them out.

If emails are preferred, which data/contents should i sent over filters at adguard.com?

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/37479424/362c70d4-9f3d-4245-9088-99220356a4e4)


[^0]: https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/954ee9aec234c550e3c7ec4304e65b4258a74196/easylist/easylist_general_hide.txt#L6922
[^1]: https://www.clien.net/service/board/park/17643068
[^2]: https://www.clien.net/service/board/lecture/18215622

comment.body:
>I'm not 100% sure what you mean by all filter lists, but in the second tab I toggled everything off (ad blocking, tracking protection, annoyance blocking, dns protection, etc)[...]

Yes, it was what I meant.
So, as far as I understand, it's not filter list issue.

On the screenshots I see that `iquic` connections are blocked.
Could you please open AdGuard app, go to `Settings` (last tab), then `General` -> `Advanced` -> `Low-level settings`, now find `QUIC bypass packages` (it should be in `Protection` section) and add `com.google.android.gm` to it, and then check if issue still occurs?
I'm not sure if this will fix the problem, but I think that it's worth to check.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://usps.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fusps.com) ### Comment > I am subscribed to a service called informed delivery from my local post office that sends me scans of the snail mail I am to receive. > > If I have adguard turned on, the images do not appear in my Gmail app on android. I can whitelist the entire Gmail app, but I would prefer to still have the blocking for most things. What is the easiest way to let these images for these specific emails from USPS through? Username: `@arebelspy` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
I'm not 100% sure what you mean by all filter lists, but in the second tab I toggled everything off (ad blocking, tracking protection, annoyance blocking, dns protection, etc) and the images do not display still. Let me know if there was a different setting you wanted checked.

Attached via website are the two screenshots described n my previous post.

![Screenshot_2024-03-21-11-43-33-06_a93965f46c4a4b0ed1be737bdf2bc8fc](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/28885676/3dd9fe13-3520-4460-a785-8849e5dc30ed)
![Screenshot_2024-03-21-11-43-24-40_a93965f46c4a4b0ed1be737bdf2bc8fc](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/28885676/59ca718d-547e-48c1-9590-412985996df3)

BTW, if I google AdGuard Gmail Attachments (the obvious step I took before contacting support), I do see a number of people have had this issue before (several reddit threads, etc.), but no real solution. 

Obviously it isn't widespread, or it would have been mentioned more and fixed; IDK if it's something about my device, or what (can't be version of android, as there are 4 year old posts with the same issue--although some of the posts don't describe the same issue, some do, so I suppose it's possible none of them are the same issue; it does seem a few are the same though)

One other thing that might help--it appears to be only image attachments. PDFs, for example, open fine. But if I click an image attachment, it displays as a white box. It may be blocking where Google is pulling the image from.

I appreciate your help resolving this!

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://www.sugirl.info/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sugirl.info%2F) ### Comment > The problem arises because Adguard on iPhone struggles to manage iframes effectively. It lacks a specific rule to conceal the space reserved for advertisements. While on a PC, disabling the script reduces the space to zero, the scenario differs on an iPhone. Due to the persistence of the iframe, it's expected that the advertisement frame remains visible. If there's any other reason for this issue, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/agpzif1yjhssgks8gocows80g0ogo8getmmmu77qyg.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

comment.body:
Unfortunately, I have no idea how to fix and as far as I understand, it's not filter list issue.

Maybe it's related to one of these issues:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/3724
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/3516
but these issues are old and closed currently, so I'm not sure.

Could you please report your issue here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/new/choose

comment.body: Hello, unfortunately I can't register on this website. Please provide a test account if possible (data can be sent to `filters@adguard.com`). If it is not possible to provide a test account, please try to disable filters/functions (DNS) one by one, when you find which one is causing the problem - leave it only. Then reproduce the problem and send screenshots of the filtering log (`AdGuard icon--> gear --> Advanced --> filtering log`) to the mail, with the issue number in the subject line or in a comment on the github. Screenshots can be taken on macos devices with `cmd+shift+4 `- select area or `cmd+shift+4+space` - select window.

comment.body:
Yes, you are right the question about https filtering is worth including in the bug report. AdGuard for Mac has many advantages over the safari extension because the extension has safari browser restrictions on the number of rules used in content blockers . Because of the limitations, AdGuard for Safari uses optimized filter sheets. If some applications do not work well with https filtering enabled - you can remove these applications from the list of automatically filtered applications. (`Network --> General --> Automatically filter applications --> uncheck applications that do not work properly`).
AdGuard for Mac has more functionality and works better on sites that require advanced blocking, as there are no issues with the Safari restrictions that the AdGuard extension for Safari has. But here of course the choice is yours whether you need the extra options.

If the ads are now blocked correctly, then I'm closing the issue. If you have any questions or issues with ad blocking, feel free to mention me. Thank you for your feedback!

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~90 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

issue.title: www.twitch.tv
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/thunny](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Fthunny) ### Comment > Das Problem kann umgangen werden in dem in dem Stream rechts die lila Krone bzw. das rechts angezeigte überlagerte Icon angeklickt wird und das "Sichtbar" abgewählt wird. > Es tritt in Zusammenhang mit der integrierten TwitchOverlay Erweiterung u.a. "Slay the Relics reborn" und auch "Prime Gaming benefits Reminder" aus. Siehe Screenshot. > > Bei den Einstellung des Icons (Icon anklicken) muss das "Sichtbar" abgewählt werden damit der Stream normal dargestellt wird. Ist er angewählt ist das Bild dauerhaft weiß (mit aktivierter Ad Guard Erweiterung im Browser). ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/thunny](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Fthunny) ### Comment > Das Problem kann umgangen werden in dem in dem Stream rechts die lila Krone bzw. das rechts angezeigte überlagerte Icon angeklickt wird und das "Sichtbar" abgewählt wird. > Es tritt in Zusammenhang mit der integrierten TwitchOverlay Erweiterung u.a. "Slay the Relics reborn" und auch "Prime Gaming benefits Reminder" aus. Siehe Screenshot. > > Bei den Einstellung des Icons (Icon anklicken) muss das "Sichtbar" abgewählt werden damit der Stream normal dargestellt wird. Ist er angewählt ist das Bild dauerhaft weiß (mit aktivierter Ad Guard Erweiterung im Browser). ### Screenshots

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/robcdee](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Frobcdee) ### Comment > I recently purchased this program. It worked great for a month then stopped working. The problem occurs on twitch only, after clicking on a channel and "blocking ads" disappears in the top left hand corner, the stream freezes(loading icon) and doesn't not load at all. The only work around I have found is to use the "do not filter for 30 seconds". But then I am watching ads. I did not include any relevant photos as it is a simple freezing error about 30 seconds into the stream. Automatic filtering is turned on and I have not messed around with any settings, everything is default. Username: `@none` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.
